byline.contributor: Kate Pastor and Jada F. Smith contributed reporting. Susan C. Beachy contributed research.
byline.original: By RACHEL L. SWARNS and CAMPBELL ROBERTSON

abstract: Targeting of black church by gunman Dylann Roof is part of long history of attacks on black churches beginning when such institutions were formed after Civil War; event, while tragic, does not come as surprise to those aware of broader history.
lead_paragraph: After the Civil War, black churches became what the scholar W. E. B. Du Bois and others have described as the “first social institution fully controlled by black men in America.” And before long, those institutions became targets.

headline.main: Black Church Is Target Again for Deadly Strike at the Heart
